CONJUGATES: gasolines (rare plural, referring to types or batches)
ETYMOLOGY: Coined around 1863 in the U.S. from the word 'gas' (ultimately from Greek 'khaos' via Dutch 'gas') combined with the chemical suffix '-ol' (related to oil) and '-ine' (a suffix forming names of substances).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: uncountable noun; refers to a substance
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A volatile, flammable liquid hydrocarbon mixture obtained from petroleum, primarily used as fuel in spark-ignited internal combustion engines (especially in North America).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 汽油；一种易挥发、易燃的液态碳氢化合物混合物，主要用作火花点火内燃机（如汽车发动机）的燃料。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The price of gasoline has reached an all-time high this summer.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 今年夏天，汽油的价格达到了历史新高。

REGISTER: General usage, highly common in North America; technical context.
